intro: Camellia pentagonalema, commonly known as the five-angled camellia, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Theaceae family, characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, camellia-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals that give it its common name. The leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a glossy appearance, contributing to its ornamental value.
